meanings.definition: Suitable for being rented or leased
meanings.sent1: The apartment was tenantable, with clean walls and working appliances.
meanings.sent2: The landlord ensured that the house was tenantable before listing it for rent.
meanings.sent3: The tenantable cottage had a cozy fireplace perfect for marshmallow toasting.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent described the property as a tenantable oasis in the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The bright, airy rooms made the apartment undeniably tenantable for any potential renter.

meanings.definition: Fit to be occupied by a tenant
meanings.sent1: The spacious rooms and modern amenities made the house tenantable for any tenant.
meanings.sent2: The landlord made sure the apartment was tenantable by fixing all the plumbing issues.
meanings.sent3: The quirky design of the tenantable loft appealed to the artistic tenant looking for a unique space.
meanings.sent4: The old mansion, though in need of repairs, had a certain charm that made it tenantable to history enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cabin in the woods was the epitome of a tenantable retreat for nature lovers.
